channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Fraud claims emerge in Venezuelan election. And, Trump hopes to regain the spotlight
item.description: Nicolas Maduro has been declared the winner in Venezuela's presidential election, but the opposition is claiming fraud. And, former President Trump is trying to regain the spotlight from Harris.
item.content:encoded:
Nicolas Maduro has been declared the winner in Venezuela's presidential election, but the opposition is claiming fraud. And, former President Trump is trying to regain the spotlight from Harris.

(Image credit: Jalaa Marey)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Olympic Prizes: How did we get to the 3 medals?
item.description: Olympic athletes strive to win gold, silver and bronze medals. But there was a different prize when the games originated in Greece more than 2,700 years ago.
item.content:encoded: Olympic athletes strive to win gold, silver and bronze medals. But there was a different prize when the games originated in Greece more than 2,700 years ago.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Israel blames Hezbollah for a deadly rocket strike in the Golan Heights
item.description: After a strike this weekend that killed 12 children in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights, is an all out war between Israel and the Lebanese group Hezbollah likely?
item.content:encoded: After a strike this weekend that killed 12 children in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights, is an all out war between Israel and the Lebanese group Hezbollah likely?
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: With less than 100 days to Election Day, Harris must choose a running mate
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel asks Elaine Kamarck, author of "Picking the Vice President," about the Harris campaign's search for a running mate.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel asks Elaine Kamarck, author of "Picking the Vice President," about the Harris campaign's search for a running mate.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Harris is leaning into her history as a prosecutor. It's not the first time
item.description: Five years ago, Harris also said she’d ‘prosecute the case’ against Trump. This time around, it hits a bit differently.
item.content:encoded:
Five years ago, Harris also said she’d ‘prosecute the case’ against Trump. This time around, it hits a bit differently.

(Image credit: Marcio Jose Sanchez)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Biden calls for term limits, enforceable ethics rules for Supreme Court justices
item.description: The president is also expected to call for a constitutional amendment that would limit the broad immunity presidents now enjoy after a recent Supreme Court decision.
item.content:encoded:
The president is also expected to call for a constitutional amendment that would limit the broad immunity presidents now enjoy after a recent Supreme Court decision.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk

item.title: A court decision worries developers eyeing Florida's aging condos
item.description: Three years after the collapse of a condo building in Florida, developers say a court decision may stop them from demolishing and replacing older residential buildings.
item.content:encoded:
Three years after the collapse of a condo building in Florida, developers say a court decision may stop them from demolishing and replacing older residential buildings.

(Image credit: Greg Allen, NPR)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: Some Jewish Israelis are making the choice to leave Israel over the war in Gaza
item.description: Many Jewish Israelis are looking for ways to leave the country after Oct. 7, saying they don't feel safe in Israel anymore and that their government has failed them.
item.content:encoded: Many Jewish Israelis are looking for ways to leave the country after Oct. 7, saying they don't feel safe in Israel anymore and that their government has failed them.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: Winklevoss twins and crypto ties seek to shape Arizona Democratic primary race
item.description: The Winklevoss twins, crypto money and other interests are seeking to shape the Phoenix-area Democratic primary on Tuesday for a U.S. House seat.
item.content:encoded:
The Winklevoss twins, crypto money and other interests are seeking to shape the Phoenix-area Democratic primary on Tuesday for a U.S. House seat.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Israel blames Hezbollah for deadly rocket strike. Venezuela’s electoral authority declares President Maduro the winner of Sunday’s election. Donald Trump escalates his attacks against VP Harris.
item.content:encoded: Israel blames Hezbollah for deadly rocket strike. Venezuela’s electoral authority declares President Maduro the winner of Sunday’s election. Donald Trump escalates his attacks against VP Harris.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep
